description:
Autokey is much more than a hotkey mapper. It allows assigning large strings (or short ones of course) to "phrases" for full text replacement. So you might have addfullx be replaced by your full address, including new lines.

One of my biggest pains in moving to Linux was the loss of AutoHotkey. And then I found AutoKey. Wonderful, wonderful tool.

the GTK version has issues.

I've submitted scripts to the wiki in the course of 10 years now. Covering advanced concepts. Just copy and paste to get up to speed quickly!
summary: Great tool, always install the QT version tho

description: no matter what i tried it wouldn't work
Assigned a keyboard shortcuts. Intergrates well with Kubuntu.
Works great and enables python scripts (for some reason it doesn't open for me from the menu but it works when i write autokey into the terminal and click the icon in the tray)
NFG! It accepts the phrases but won't execute them.
Application très utile et bien faite
